column4: unfortunately, i think we're stuck with sloppy focus from here on out. you can play around with the configuration resource editor, and set the mouse focus setting there, but i believe strict follow is no longer an option.
of course, you can always try another window manager. i just kind of dealt with it on gnome/compiz
ctrl-alt-minus does nothing, i take it?
it zooms out or changes resolutions, but it doesnt reenable the monitor
nope, two lcds. an nvidia card. Usually extend the desktop across them
logging out and in again doesn't help?
it might.... there's an application I'm having trouble saving without being able to reenable the other monitor
also, you might try running the nvidia control utility.
running the nvidia control utility doesn't help, however
alright, enough playing with nvidia control panel fixed it. thanks
out of curiosity, what did you have to change?
I had to manually disable twinview, and reenable it for the second monitor
mdadm.conf should use UUIDs, and shouldn't care what the device is called (ideally)
OK, I wasn't sure, since you specify the /dev location when creating the array. thanks
yeah, i'm fairly sure those are mapped to UUIDs at array creation. easy to double-check, though.
